Q01.title: Q01 We're going fishing
Q01.context: Un homme [A] et sa femme croisent une autre femme [B] en chemin.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Good morning!

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Hello!

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: How are youSG?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: I’m fine, and youDU?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Oh, weEXC:DU are fine too.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Where are youDU going?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Well, weEXC:DU’re walking down to the river, over there.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: What for? Are youDU going to be bathing?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: No, no! WeEXC:DU won’t be bathing.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: WeEXC:DU’re going fishing.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: We’ll try to catch some river fish for dinner.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Oh I see. Is there a celebration in the village, or something?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: I didn’t know.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: No, there’s no celebration.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: WeEXC:DU just need food for ourEXC:PL family.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: My wife had bought a chicken at the market the other day,

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: but ourEXC:DU childrenDU ate it all already:

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: now weEXC:PL have nothing left at home!

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Besides, weEXC:PL don’t have enough money any more.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: WeEXC:DU really have to go fishing today.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: I understand.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: I’m sorry that youPL have no food left.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: I can help youPL, my friends.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: My husband and I, weEXC:DU have lots of vegetables from ourEXC:DU garden,

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: which he harvested yesterday, and brought back home.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: If youDU want, weEXC:DU can give youPL some.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Oh really? Thank youDU very much!

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: YouDU’re welcome.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: YouDU’ll give usEXC:PL some vegetables, and weEXC:DU’ll give youDU some fish.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Tonight weINC:PL will all eat together.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Great! Good bye!

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: See youSG later!

Q02.title: Q02 Preparing for the New Year
Q02.context: Two adults, A and B, are speaking together.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Hey, you know what? In two months’ time, we’ll have celebrations for the New Year

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Oh, that’s right. This time, the people from village X will all be coming to our community:

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: men and women, children, old people, entire families…

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: We should welcome them in a friendly way,

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: just like they did to us last year.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Yes of course, like we always do.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Our leaders will start with a welcome speech.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Then, people will pray in the morning.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: After that, we’ll all share lunch together.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: In the afternoon, I hope we can have songs and dances.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: The people of X will sing their songs, dance their dances;

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: we too, we shall sing our own songs, and do our own dances…

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Yes, good idea. Everyone loves music and dance.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: As we find some rest, our elders will be able to tell stories from the olden times, for the young to hear.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: This will be great. They know so many stories.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: And then, in the late afternoon, our two communities will part again.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: That will be the end of the day of celebration.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Remember that you and I are in charge of the organization this year.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Perhaps we INC:DU should call a meeting tomorrow morning in the community

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: and tell our people what they should do.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Some of us can clean the village area,

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: set up the place for the celebration.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Other people can make the costumes for the dances.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: We must choose which dances to showcase;

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: and we must rehearse them!

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Also, don’t forget: we’ll have to prepare food,

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: enough food for two hundred people.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Oh dear, that will be a lot of work for us all.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: A lot of work indeed. Let us start today!

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Good morning Doctor, how are you?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: I’m fine, and you?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Well… I’m not feeling well these days.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: That’s why I came to see you.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: What’s happening to you? You look sick.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: I can’t sleep well at night.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: I sweat, I have nightmares, and then I wake up in the middle of the night.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Sometimes I feel hot, sometimes I’m cold. I must have fever?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Let me check your forehead… Oh yes, you’re hot!

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Do you cough?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: No, I don’t cough.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: But every time I wake up, I’m very thirsty; I feel I need to drink.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: And also, my belly hurts. It’s painful.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Does it hurt during the day? or only at night?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Mostly at night. I don’t know why.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Doctor, I’m a bit worried: what is going on?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Did you eat anything particular lately?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Hm, let me remember… No, I don’t think so.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Oh wait, actually yes I did!

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Last week, my child came back from the forest with some strange fruit I had never seen.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: He gave them to me, for me to try.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Did you?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Yes I did. Actually I liked it, it was sweet. I ate many of them.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: But then, I became sick after that.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: I see. It must have been that fruit that made you sick.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: If you hadn’t eaten so much, you wouldn’t have gotten sick like this.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Oh Doctor, you’re right. I shouldn’t have.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: What should I do now?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Don’t worry. I’ll give you some medicine for you to drink.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: You will take it twice a day: once in the morning, and once again in the evening, after dinner. Alright?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Alright Doctor. And then I’ll be better?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Yes, you should get better soon.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: This is efficient medicine against fever and belly-ache.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Also, you must get some rest.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Don’t go to work: you need to sleep.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Alright Doctor, I understand. I’ll get some rest.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Thank you so much!

Q04.title: Q04 Where’s my notebook?
Q04.context: A young girl [A] is asking her elder brother [B] for her school notebook.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Brother, have you seen my notebook?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: I’ve been looking for it everywhere, but I can’t find it!

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: I don’t know, sister. Which notebook?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: It’s my math book. It’s a thick, blue one.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: You’ve seen it already.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: I was doing my homework on it last night in the dining room.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Well, you probably left it there, then!

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: No. I put it away in my schoolbag before I went to sleep. I think.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Hm, did you look in our room, beside your bed?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Yes I did; it’s not there.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Or perhaps on Dad’s desk, maybe it’s hidden under another book?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Wait… No, I can’t find it.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Let me look in the kitchen… Hm, not here either.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: But I need it for my math class today!

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: The teacher will be quite angry if I don’t have my notebook with me.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: He will think I didn’t do my homework.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Uh oh… I think I found it!

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Really?! where?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Look at our little brother out there in the garden.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: What’s that he’s holding in his hands?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Isn’t it your notebook?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Oh my god, yes it is. But he has shredded it into pieces!

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: It looks like he’s been playing with it all morning.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Oh dear, what happened to my homework?!

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Now I need to buy a new notebook,

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: and start my work all over again.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Poor me! What a disaster…

Q05.title: Q05 A family album
Q05.context: A person [A] is showing a photo album to a friend [B].

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Have you ever seen pictures of my family?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Well, I’ve met some of your relatives, but I’ve never seen your pictures.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Here is an old photo album I just found in my parents’ room.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Oh, show it to me please!

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Who’s this on that first photo?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: It looks like olden times, it’s in black and white.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: These are my grandparents, on my mother’s side: Grandpa here on the left, and Grandma on the right.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: The people around them must be their friends, or other relatives.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Was that the day of their wedding?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: No, I don’t think so. On their wedding, they were older than this.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: This must have been the day when they got engaged.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: In those times, the day of engagement used to be a major event for the whole family, and people would wear beautiful clothes, and all.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Did you know them?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Who? My grandparents?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Yes, your grandparents on the photo.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Actually no. I heard they died before I was born. They were born a long time ago.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Oh I see. And who’s that on the second photo?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: This is my mother, when she was a child.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: I guess she was coming back from school: look at her schoolbag.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Oh yeah, nice. And the small boy behind her, who’s that?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: That’s my uncle Teri. You haven’t met him, he lives far away from here.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: And what school did they attend then?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: That was an old school that doesn’t exist any more. It was located down the road, to the west, towards the lake.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Let me see this other photo.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: This woman is surely your mother again, carrying a child on her back.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Oh, I think I know who this child is. That’s you!

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: That’s me indeed! How did you recognize me?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Well, on that photo you’re a small child, but I recognize your eyes and your smile.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: You look mischievous on that picture.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: You haven’t changed much!

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Ha ha. But I’m not a child any more, I’ve grown up now.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: Today my mother would not be able to carry me on her back like that!

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.english: I’m taller than her, and heavier too.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.english: Ha, that’s true. You’ve eaten too much!
